thread.title: UMass stock watch: Marken Michel shows he can be Tajae Sharpe's wingman vs. FIU
thread.title_full: UMass stock watch: Marken Michel shows he can be Tajae Sharpe's wingman vs. FIU

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass stock watch: Marken Michel shows he can be Tajae Sharpe's wingman vs. FIU
text:
AMHERST â€“ Here's a look at whose stock is rising and falling following the University of Massachusetts football team's 24-14 win over Florida International Saturday. Trending up 
Marken Michel: Lost in all the Tajae Sharpe hype is that Michel is having his most productive season as a Minuteman. The senior wideout caught a pair of touchdowns, including a 5-yard fade that put UMass out of range of FIU midway through the fourth quarter. 
Logan Laurent: Back-to-back mentions here for Laurent, which makes sense given that he's now playing two positions for the Minutemen. He punted only twice, averaging 47.5 yards, but it was his 48-yard field goal at the end of the first half that drew the loudest McGuirk Stadium cheer of the day. 
Defensive line: The grunts down in the trenches stepped up in a huge way. More than that, it was who along the defensive line that was getting snaps. Sha-Ki Holines and Robert Kitching were out, meaning Peter Angeh, Trey Seals Enock Asante & Co. had to work over time. Gutty performance by them and a good job by the coaching staff to have the unit prepared. Trending down 
Pass protection: Blake Frohnapfel looked shaky and uncomfortable on several occasions, thanks largely to an FIU pass rush that had him jumpy in the pocket and scrambling far more often than UMass wants. 
Marquis Young: So Mark Whipple didn't listen to my pleas to unleash the freshman running back. Instead, Young carried the ball just five times for 13 yards. Meanwhile, Lorenzo Woodley got seven carries. Who knows how this backfield is going to shake out each week? 
Tight end production: Rod Mills missed his second straight game, meaning Frohnapfel's options at tight end were severely limited. A.J. Doyle played significant snaps with both Brandon Howard and Sharif Custis also held out. Jean Sifrin isn't walking through that door, so UMass fans had better get used to Shaq Harris if Mills' recovery continues to drag.
